copy: The total prison population has steadily increased over the past hundred years
Prison numbers fall, and then – as men return from the battlefields of the First World War – start to rise to new heights.
The number of people behind bars remains broadly stable, but again starts to rise as men are demobbed after the Second World War.
A consumer society has now fully arrived, and with it more goods to tempt thieves, robbers and burglars, resulting in a steady rise in the criminal population.
The penal system becomes the latest battleground for the Conservatives and Labour – particularly after the 1993 murder of James Bulger – which helps drive up the jail population.
